III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description
1

(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 8/9/25, a youth was choked by a supervisor within their office.
Two staff members were present and did not intervene.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 8/12/2025.
There was no additional information to share.
Youth A, Youth B, Youth Advocate, and Staff 2 were
interviewed face to face on 8/11/25 at Vista Maria in
collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Youth A reported she had been placed at Vista Maria for nearly a
year. She stated she did not feel safe there, alleging staff had
previously put their hands on her and choked her. Youth A
described a recent incident involving Staff 1. She stated she and
other youth were lining up to attend a session called "Chick Time."
However, while walking over, Youth A reported she did not want to
participate. Instead, she went to the family room, laid down on the
couch, and turned on the fan because she was feeling irritated.
According to Youth A, Staff 1 entered the room and told her she
could not remain there, raising his voice in the process. Youth A
reported Staff 1 also threatened to take away her 1:30 p.m. phone
call privilege. She stated she told Staff 1 not to yell at her because
she had not been yelling at him. Youth A reported she then got up,
approached Staff 1, and pushed him. At that point, both Staff 1
and Staff 2 grabbed her by the arms—one on each side. Youth A
stated she was taken to the office by Staff 1, where she was
dropped on the floor. While in the office, Youth A reported Staff 1
said, "There’s no cameras in here, watch what you say." She
alleged he placed his knee into her stomach. Youth A stated she
began kicking and screaming, calling out for help from Staff 2 and
Staff 3. She reported Staff 1 crossed her arms over her chest,
restricting her movement, and that she could not breathe.
Eventually, she said, Staff 1 released her. Once free, Youth A
reported she yelled at Staff 3, asking, “How could you let him do
that to me?” She also stated while in the office, something had
fallen on her and scraped her leg. Youth A reported she was
offered medical attention but refused to be seen. She stated she
2

had no visible marks or bruises, and Staff 2 provided her with a
Band-Aid.
Youth B reported living on the same wing as Youth A. She
reported not feeling safe at Vista Maria. Although she reported
never seeing a staff member physically hit a youth, she had
witnessed Youth A being restrained by staff in the past. Youth B
reported she was not present at the facility during the recent
altercation involving Youth A and was only told about the incident
afterward. According to her, Youth A reported what happened with
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3. Youth B reported Youth A told her
Staff 1 grabbed her hands and made her choke herself, while Staff
2 and Staff 3 stood by and watched. She also reported Youth A
said Staff 1 placed his knee in her stomach and told her to
apologize.
Staff 2 reported being on shift when the incident occurred. She
said she and Staff 3 were walking the youths to a group session
called “Chick Time.” Staff 2 said Youth A refused to attend the
event and walked back to the family group room to lay down.
Because Youth A required two staff members for supervision due
to her behaviors, Staff 3 assisted Staff 2. Staff 2 reported Youth A
had a history of physical aggression toward adults. Once in the
room, Staff 2 said Youth A laid down on the couch. Shortly after,
Staff 1 entered the room to redirect Youth A. Staff 2 reported Staff
1 told Youth A she could not remain in the room and remained
calm and not rude during the interaction. However, Youth A
responded by telling Staff 1 to “shut up.” It was also reported
Youth A said to Staff 2, “I hate you bitch, I don’t like you.” Staff 2
reported she and Staff 3 tried to calm Youth A down, but Youth A
got up off the couch and attempted to close the door by pushing
all three staff members out of the room. However, Staff 3
remained inside the room with Youth A.
Staff 1 and Staff 3 were interviewed face to face on 8/14/2025
in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Staff 1 reported he had been employed for one year and was
currently a Team Lead. He reported he was present on the day of
the incident. Staff 1 reported there was an event the youths were
going to called “Chick Time.” He reported they all lined up to leave
and be transported there around 11 a.m. Staff 1 reported he was
in the office when he heard Youth A. He came out and saw her in
the family room across from the office. He reported Youth A
refused to go to Chick Time, went into the family room, turned on
the fan, and laid on the couch. Staff 2 told Youth A she was not
allowed to be in the family room, and when Youth A did not get up,
Staff 1 stepped in and told her she could not be there and needed
3

to go back to her room. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 was also trying to
talk to Youth A, who told Staff 3, “I don’t like you. I don’t know why
you are here anyway. I hate you.” Youth A then told Staff 1, “Quit
yelling at me.” He reported he was not yelling. Youth A got up off
the couch and walked to the door where Staff 1 was standing. He
reported he and Staff 3 were on the outside of the room while
Staff 2 was inside with Youth A. Youth A tried to close the door,
but he and Staff 3 blocked it. Youth A then started reaching for
Staff 1, who walked away to the office. Youth A eventually closed
the door. Staff 1 reported he returned and told Youth A to keep the
same energy for her 1:30 p.m. phone call and then walked away.
Youth A then charged after him. He tried to close the office door,
but the stopper was in the way. Youth A grabbed his shirt and
would not let go. He reported he asked Youth A why she was
doing that, but she did not respond and scratched him on his
neck. Staff 1 reported he attempted to get Youth A off him, with
Staff 3 and Staff 2 assisting. He reported using the “push and pull”
method, grabbing the person’s hand and the area they held to get
them to release. It eventually worked, but Youth A fell to the
ground. Staff 1 reported he tried to go back to the office but again
could not shut the door. Youth A forced her way into the office.
Staff attempted a management hold where two staff grabbed each
arm, but Youth A dropped to the ground, kicking, flailing her arms,
and screaming. Staff 1 reported Youth A lifted the desk off the
ground, causing some items to fall onto her. Staff 2 and Staff 3
tried to remove chairs and other items from the office. Staff 1 was
asked if he ever choked or kneed Youth A. He reported he did not
touch her after she dropped to the ground. He reported Youth A
was screaming she could not breathe, but no one was preventing
her from breathing. He described her as screaming and
hyperventilating. After a few minutes, Youth A got up and ran to
the gym, where she was aggressively confronting Staff 3, saying
things like, “You let that man fuck me up.” Staff 1 reported he
stayed at the door of the gym in case and waited until another
staff member arrived to calm her down. During the interview, Staff
1 was observed with scratches on his neck and face.
Staff 3 reported being present on the day of the incident and was
one of the staff who assisted Staff 1 during the altercation with
Youth A. Staff 3 reported they were all going to an outing, but
Youth A did not want to go and requested Staff 2 stay with her.
Staff 3 reported she was on behavior monitoring with Youth A and
therefore had to stay behind as well. Staff 3 reported Youth A did
not want her to stay with her. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 was in the
office, and on the way back to Youth A’s room, Youth A decided to
go into the family room. Staff 3 reported Staff 2 attempted to
redirect Youth A by asking, "Do you want me to go to your wing
with you?" Staff 3 stated Youth A told her she hated her and did
4

not like her. Staff 1 came and tried to talk to and redirect Youth A.
Staff 2 was inside the room with Youth A when Youth A got up
and tried to close the door, but Staff 1 was blocking her. This
triggered Youth A, and she attacked Staff 1. Staff 1 tried to close
the office door, but the door stopper was in the way. Staff 3
reported Staff 2 and her were telling Youth A to stop hitting Staff 1
and she would not. Staff 3 reported Youth A went into the office
and was trying to pick things up like scissors and a stapler. The
staff were moving items out. Staff 3 reported she was kicked by
Youth A and showed a large bruise on her leg. Staff 3 reported
she then left the office after being kicked to call Staff 4. Staff 3
reported Youth A then ran into the gym so Staff 1, Staff 2, and
Staff 3 followed Youth A. Staff 3 reported, Youth A was screaming
and she pinned Staff 3 into the corner for several minutes yelling
and pointing and touching her face. Staff 3 reported Youth A was
saying, " You let him hit me. Bitch Don't come to my funeral. I am
going to kill myself. You don't care. Look at me!" Staff 3 reported
she was scared as Youth A is twice her size. Staff 3 reported Staff
4 eventually came into the gym and calmed Youth A down. Staff 3
reported Staff 1, Staff 2 and including herself intervened correctly
according to their training. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 did not hurt,
choke, or place his body on top of Youth A.
MDHHS Pre-disposition meeting held on 9/5/2025 with
MDHHS worker.
There were no MDHHS findings. However, there are pending
charges against Youth A by staff from Vista Maria.
Video Review:
The video began with Staff 2 and Staff 3 walking Youth A into the
office. Several youths, including a group of girls, were observed
lining up in the hallway. Youth A was then seen exiting the office
and joining the line. Staff 1 was also present in the hallway,
observing the scene. After all youths left the hallway, Staff 1 exited
through the double doors near the office.
Youth A re-entered the area with three staff members and
proceeded into the family room. Staff 1 came around the corner as
the third staff member exited. Staff 2 and Staff 3 entered the room
with Youth A, while Staff 1 stood in the doorway engaging in a
conversation. The conversation continued for several minutes,
though the content was unclear as there is no sound.
Youth A approached Staff 1 at the door and, after about 30
seconds, attempted to close it. Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 tried to
prevent the door from closing, but Youth A managed to shut it with
Staff 2 inside and Staff 1 and Staff 3 left outside.
5

Once the door was closed, Youth A backed away. Staff 1 then
reopened the door, said something to Youth A, and walked away
toward the office. Youth A ran after Staff 1, who attempted to
block her from making physical contact. Youth A grabbed Staff 1’s
shirt and refused to let go. Staff 2 grabbed Youth A’s left arm,
while her right hand continued to grip Staff 1.
Staff 1 attempted to use the push-and-pull method to safely break
free. He moved toward Youth A, using a counter-intuitive
approach, then pushed and tried to loosen her grip. Eventually, he
pulled away and successfully freed his shirt from her grasp.
During this, Staff 3 was seen trying to protect Staff 1 from being
struck, while Staff 2 attempted to apply a physical management
hold by wrapping her arms around Youth A’s arms.
After freeing himself, Staff 1 returned to the office and attempted
to close the door. Youth A followed and forced her way into the
office. Staff 2 tried to pull her back into the hallway by reaching out
for Youth A’s arms/shoulders but was unsuccessful. At that point,
a chair was pushed from the office into the hallway. Staff 3 was
observed removing another chair from the office. Shortly after,
Staff 2 brought out another chair. Staff 3 then removed a desk
from the office, made a phone call, and continued to stand in the
hallway. Staff 1 and Staff 2 remained inside the office with Youth
A. Another desk was later removed from the office. Youth A
eventually walked out of the office, followed by all three staff
members.
Youth A entered the gym, with the staff following behind. Inside
the gym, Youth A began throwing objects around. She then
attempted to leave, but Staff 1 prevented her by standing in front
of the door. Youth A walked around the gym, waving her arms and
following Staff 2, who maintained a defensive hand stance. Youth
A then approached Staff 3, backing her into a corner and
preventing her from leaving for approximately nine minutes. After
allowing Staff 3 to leave the corner, Youth A again attempted to
exit the gym. While Staff 1 continued to stand in front of the door,
Youth A struck him in the head. Staff 1 then exited the gym. Youth
A sat in the corner for about one minute. Another staff member
entered the gym and hugged her, while Staff 3 exited. Staff 2 also
left the gym shortly afterward. The remaining staff member spoke
with Youth A and eventually sat in front of the gym doors. The
video ends.
Documents Reviewed:
Staff 1’s personnel file: On 8/5/2025, Staff 1 received a Written
Warning for employee behavior violation and on 5/9/2025, Staff 1
received a verbal Warning, employee behavior violation. Staff 1
6

completed CPI training on 7/8/2025 and Motivational Interviewing
training on 5/01/25.
Staff 2’s personnel file: There is no disciplinary history related to
this investigation. Staff 2 received a written Final Warning due to
attendance and punctuality policy violation on 3/18/25 and
6/24/2025. Staff 2 completed Motivational Interviewing on
06/05/2025. Staff 2 completed CPI training on 06/25/25 and
9/10/25.
Staff 3’s personnel file: On 5/1/25 received a written warning for
employee behavior violation. Staff 3 completed CPI training on
06/25/25.
Medical Report dated 08/12/25: Youth A received a medical
exam on 8/12/25 after reporting abdominal pain that began
following a physical management incident on 8/9/25. The youth
described the pain as mild but noted it worsened when moving
from sitting to standing. No visible bruising, redness, or marks
were found on the abdomen. A superficial scratch with minor
inflammation was observed on the left forearm, reportedly
sustained on 8/9/25. Another superficial scratch was found on the
left lower leg without inflammation, which Youth A stated occurred
when something fell on the area in the supervisor's office. The
youth denied pain in the leg. Youth A also reported neck pain, but
there were no visible marks or bruising, and she could move her
neck without increased discomfort. After the exam, Youth A
returned to the common area and resumed activities.
Incident Report: #4039 dated 08/09/2025 and authored by Staff
4 is consistent with all interviews.
Incident Report: #4040 dated 8/09/25 and authored by Staff 3
was consistent with Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 interview.
Incident Report #4045 dated 8/09/25 authored by Staff 1,
documents the police report that was filed with Dearborn Heights
Police Department. Case # 25-21630
Critical Incidents POL- 005-007: This policy instructs staff on
how to recognize critical incidents and take appropriate steps to
prevent them.
Incidents and Emergencies POL-014-035: This policy
documents what incidents must be report immediately and who
the incidents are to be reported to.
Policy 005-010 – Behavior Management: This policy states
7

physical intervention shall not be used as a form of coercion,
discipline, convenience, or retaliation by staff.
Policy POL-022-114 – Employee Behavior:
This policy prohibits staff behavior such as fighting, assaulting,
threatening, or intimidating clients.
Policy POL-022-406 – Staff and Client Interaction:
Staff are expected to maintain professional and appropriate
conduct in all interactions with clients. Employees must foster
mutual trust and establish positive working relationships. The
policy explicitly states corporal punishment including spanking,
paddling, slapping, pinching, twisting arms, or pulling hair is strictly
prohibited under any circumstances.
Analysis The Agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review, staff 1 restrained Youth A using the
trained and approved restraint technique.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
